page.title: 15LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN SWINFORD
page.content: { THE PARISH COUNCIL The Parish Council which was formed in 1894 is made up of a Chairman, Mr. John Mourant and four members of the village, all elected every four years. They are assisted by a Parish Clerk, Mrs. Lucy Barnett and meet every six weeks in the Village Hall. A proportion of the{rates}is given to the Council by the Harborough District Council which they use to pay for the street lighting, the upkeep of the Cemetery and to support other village projects. The Council recently granted Â£400 towards the cost of the new Meeting Room in the Village Hall, and plan a similar grant for the Youth Club. The{County Councillor}for this part of Leicestershire is Mr.Tom Mattocks and the{M.P.}is Mr.Nigel Lawson, the present{Chancellor of the Exchequer.
